Title: Authorized Access
Plain_Language_Description: Only authorized people should have accounts on systems that handle CUI.
Example_Evidence: User account export, HR offboarding checklist, access request forms
Notes: Plan to review all local/domain accounts and disable unused ones.

Title: Limit System Access
Plain_Language_Description: Give users only the minimum access needed for their job.
Example_Evidence: Group membership report, role-based access table
Notes: Need to define and document roles: Finance, IT Admin, Student Worker, etc.

Title: External Connections
Plain_Language_Description: Control and approve VPN, Wi-Fi, and cloud services that connect to internal systems.
Example_Evidence: VPN config, Wi-Fi PSK policy, list of approved SaaS apps
Notes: VPN with MFA implemented; document approved SaaS list.

Title: Identification & Authentication
Plain_Language_Description: Require users to log in with a unique ID and password, no anonymous access.
Notes: Local admin accounts locked down; still reviewing legacy shared logins.

Title: Multifactor Authentication
Plain_Language_Description: Use MFA for admin and remote access accounts.
Notes: Rolling out MFA to all staff; some service accounts still under review.

Title: System Patching
Plain_Language_Description: Keep OS and software updated with vendor patches.
Example_Evidence: Patch reports, update schedules, WSUS/Intune logs
Notes: Need to define patch cadence and centralize update tracking.

Title: Media Sanitization
Plain_Language_Description: Wipe or destroy media before reuse or disposal.
Notes: Process exists informally; needs written procedure.

Title: Physical Access Control
Plain_Language_Description: Restrict who can physically reach systems and network closets.
Example_Evidence: Door access logs, camera placement, key list
Notes: Server closet is locked; documenting visitor log process.

Title: Boundary Protection
Plain_Language_Description: Use a firewall and minimize open inbound ports.
Notes: Firewall in place; next step is regular rule review schedule.
